title: Wireless System Test Engineer
summary: Do you have a passion for taking on big challenges? Do you love pushing the limits of what’s considered feasible? As part of our Wireless Hardware group, you’ll be responsible for bringing groundbreaking wireless connectivity to the world.
description: You will be part of the dynamic and innovative Wireless/PHY System DVT team! The team is responsible for ensuring the Wireless/PHY system meets the design specification and functions correctly. The design specifications and functionalities include EVM, Sensitivity, Desense, RF/Baseband Performance, MIMO, Beamforming, and Coexistence. You will be responsible for testing and validating the Wireless/PHY Systems. You will also develop the test plans,execute test campaigns, generate reports, and triage issues within the wireless silicon design group on the radio and PHY. This will include debugging and extending the validation/regression test infrastructure.
key_qualifications:
Knowledge in wireless communication systems: WiFi and/or Cellular Technologies
Understanding of key performance indicators and impairments of RF and Baseband signals
Experience testing wireless silicon in a lab
Experience using and understanding lab equipment: signal analyzer, signal generator, spectrum analyzer
Experience with Python, Shell scripting, and/or C/C++/C#
education_experience: Minimum qualification is BS in Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering.
